channel.title: Speaking & Workshops on Kseniya
channel.description: Recent content in Speaking & Workshops on Kseniya

item.title: Devcon V: Panel on Inclusion & Diversity
item.description: Devcon V I was on a panel about Diversity and Inclusion in the blockchain space at Devcon V in Osaka, Japan.

item.title: ERC-1155 : Across the Multiverse
item.description: ERC-1155 : Across the Multiverse I gave a talk about Ethereum tokens and token standards: Meetup Event

item.title: DAppLadies Workshop: Intro to Solidity
item.description: Intro to Solidity Part I & II In this Intro to Solidity workshop, I’ll be starting with a basic overview of blockchain technology and and its history and progressing into teaching Solidity and how to write smart contracts. I’ll go over developer tools and the basic components that make up a smart contract. Part II will expand upon these concepts and participants will be coding their very own smart contract.

item.title: Learn Teach Code Lightning Talks
item.description: Why I Love Blockchain Technology Learn Teach Code is a tech organization based in Los Angeles, CA. In March of 2018, they held a Two-Minute Tech Talk Contest. I gave a talk about why I love blockchain technology and placed as one of the five winners. Slides Content

item.title: Women in Coding: Intro to HTML & CSS Workshop
item.description: Intermediate HTML & CSS This was a three hour workshop that built on top of the Introduction to HTML & CSS that Women in Coding was hosting. In this class, I taught students standard design practices like using a reset stylesheet, fixed navigation menus, hero images, web fonts, animations, and the basics of responsive design. Meetup Event

item.title: Women in Coding: Intro to HTML & CSS Workshop
item.description: Intro to HTML & CSS Workshop This was a two-part, 4-hour introduction to HTML & CSS hosted by Women in Coding. The class taught students how to structure a webpage with HTML and style if with CSS. Meetup Event
